snippet: A new exhibition at the Casa Arabe in Madrid features photographs of almost 250 paintings, banners and murals in Egypt, Libya, Yemen and Tunisia that were created by graffiti artists and anonymous citizens responding to the Arab Spring.
abstract: A new exhibition at the Casa Arabe in Madrid features photographs of almost 250 paintings, banners and murals in Egypt, Libya, Yemen and Tunisia that were created by graffiti artists and anonymous citizens responding to the Arab Spring.

headline.main: Arab Spring Street Art, on View in Madrid
